column1: Prisca was the second child and daughter of Polo Baggins. She married Wilibald Bolger
column2: and had three children: Wilimar Bolger
column3: Heribald Bolger and Nora Bolger. Her husband passed away before
column4: but she attended Bilbos Farewell Party with her children.The Lord of the Rings (50th Anniversary Edition) includes Prisca as a guest at the Farewell Party. In older editions of Appendix C
column5: Prisca did not appear as an attendee. Robert Foster in his The Complete Guide to Middle-earth thus states that Prisca died before  (entry for Prisca Bolger).

column1: Prisca is a Latin/Italian word meaning "former
column2: old" from which derives the name Priscilla Tolkien.http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Priscilla
